availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John W. Carter (Cincinnati, Ohio, furniture store owner and justice of the peace)

body.p: Cincinnati, Ohio, furniture store owner and justice of the peace. Kentucky native. Father of John W. Carter, Jr. and Lillie Carter. Furniture store owner in Cincinnati in 1860. Justice of the peace in Cincinnati in 1863 and 1865.

ab.bibl: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Ohio, Hamilton County, Cincinnati, p. 82; Williams' Cincinnati Directory, City Guide and Business Mirro for Year Commencing June, 1863 (Cincinnati: Williams & Company, 1863), 115; "Executrix's Sale," The Cincinnati Enquirer (Cincinnati, O.), December 3, 1877, p. 5; KYR-0001-007-0367.
